channel.title: CVE Feed for Jenkins Project -- Jenkins Active Directory Plugin
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Jenkins Project -- Jenkins Active Directory Plugin

item.title: CVE-2020-2303|2024-08-04T07:09:53.359Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins%20active%20directory%20plugin
item.description: A cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Jenkins Active Directory Plugin 2.19 and earlier allows attackers to perform connection tests, connecting to attacker-specified or previously configured Active Directory servers using attacker-specified credentials.

item.title: CVE-2020-2301|2024-08-04T07:09:54.474Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins%20active%20directory%20plugin
item.description: Jenkins Active Directory Plugin 2.19 and earlier allows attackers to log in as any user with any password while a successful authentication of that user is still in the optional cache when using Windows/ADSI mode.

item.title: CVE-2020-2300|2024-08-04T07:09:53.284Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins%20active%20directory%20plugin
item.description: Jenkins Active Directory Plugin 2.19 and earlier does not prohibit the use of an empty password in Windows/ADSI mode, which allows attackers to log in to Jenkins as any user depending on the configuration of the Active Directory server.

item.title: CVE-2020-2299|2024-08-04T07:09:53.297Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins%20active%20directory%20plugin
item.description: Jenkins Active Directory Plugin 2.19 and earlier allows attackers to log in as any user if a magic constant is used as the password.

item.title: CVE-2020-2302|2024-08-04T07:09:53.296Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins%20active%20directory%20plugin
item.description: A missing permission check in Jenkins Active Directory Plugin 2.19 and earlier allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to access the domain health check diagnostic page.
